title: Benefit of using a simulation over an experiment

content.description: Which of the following is a benefit of using a simulation instead of an experiment to make a prediction?
content.question: Select two answers.

choices.label: A simulation allows investigation of a phenomenon without the real-world limitations on time, safety, or budget.
A simulation can be used to model real-world events that are impractical for experiments.
A simulation always produces the same output, so its results can be verified.
A simulation produces results that are more accurate than experimental results.

content.answer: A simulation allows investigation of a phenomenon without the real-world limitations on time, safety, or budget.

skill.text: Skill 1.A: Investigate the situation, context, or task.
